cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 mi SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, then bending NW and slowing as it approaches the southeast North Carolina–northeast South Carolina coast, followed by a slow drift inland across the Carolinas toward the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast coast of North Carolina (Cape Fear–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the North Carolina/Virginia border to Cape Charles Light VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to the NC/VA border; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire coast from South Carolina through southern Virginia, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible Friday into Saturday with a 54 % cumulative probability; brief gusts could reach minimal hurricane strength in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay and along the Virginia Beach/Hampton Roads shoreline if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rainfall possible, locally higher amounts exceeding 4 inches could occur producing flash flooding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal flooding that can disrupt vessel traffic and cargo handling operations.
